---
status: draft
shortDescription: "\\ is a normal character in char and String literals"
shortCorrection: "\\ is an escape character in char and String literals"
concepts:

related:
# - id: LiteralNoExpression
#   relation: Special case
inOtherPl:
# - pl: JavaScript
#   id: NoCharEscape
# - pl: Python

spec:
  - id: jls21
    sections: ["3.10.7"]
plVersion:
# from: jls8
# to: jls14
text:
  - id: ssj4
    sections: ["2"]
---

A `\` in a `char` or `String` literal has no special meaning; it is no different than `X` or `+` or any other character.

frontmatter.shortDescription: \ is a normal character in char and String literals
frontmatter.shortCorrection: \ is an escape character in char and String literals
